intro: Gomesa paranapiacabensis, commonly known as the Paranapiacá gomesa, is a rare flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in riparian forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
